intro: Linociera incurvifolia f. planifolia, commonly known as the flat-leafed linociera, is a rare botanical variant characterized by its distinctive flat, broad leaves. This form exhibits a unique leaf morphology compared to the typical curved leaves of the species. It is native to specific regions in Southeast Asia, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is noted for its ornamental value. Its botanical significance lies in its morphological variation, which provides insights into genetic diversity within the species.
